name: Publication or advertising of ordinances, amendments, resolutions, and bills
text:
Notwithstanding any other provisions of law to the contrary, whenever any law requires the publication or advertisement of ordinances, amendments, resolutions, or bills, the publication or advertisement shall be in a newspaper of general circulation within the county concerned, and need not be in a daily newspaper. [L 1963, c 71, §1; Supp, §138-51; HRS ]  Case Notes

  Voluntary county decision to place advertising in papers other than plaintiff's during strike, not enjoinable.  272 F. Supp. 175.
